RevisionEvent.Note: PSP FIELDS: Initial SPASE XML resource description submission, metadata generated by SAB

ResourceHeader.Description: Radio measurements of power spectral density,radio flux density, Stokes Q, U, V parameters and angular half width of source measured by the STEREO-A/WAVES instrument. There a 319 linearly spaced frequency channels from 0.125 to 16.205 MHz. Time resolution varies with instrument mode ranging from 15 seconds to 1 minute.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: Please acknowledge the STEREO/Waves team. Data provided are Publicly available. If used in presentations or publications, please acknowledge STEREO/Waves Investigation (M. Maksimovic and S. D. Bale, PIs). Please read carefully the caveats attached to the data. For reporting purposes, we request bibliography information for any publication, etc., using these data. Please send information on the use of this data to M. Maksimovic and S. D. Bale (PIs).

PublicationInfo.Authors: M. Maksimovic, and S. D. Bale

InformationURL.Name: STEREO/WAVES instrument paper
InformationURL.Description: Bougeret, J.L., Goetz, K., Kaiser, M.L. et al. S/WAVES: The Radio and Plasma Wave Investigation on the STEREO Mission. Space Sci Rev 136, 487–528 (2008).

InformationURL.Name: Details on derivation and meaning of parameters in dataset
InformationURL.Description: Cecconi, B., Bonnin, X., Hoang, S. et al. STEREO/Waves Goniopolarimetry. Space Sci Rev 136, 549–563 (2008).

InformationURL.Name: STEREO/WAVES Dataset Angular Width of Sources
InformationURL.Description: Krupar, V., O. Santolik, B. Cecconi, M. Maksimovic, X. Bonnin, M. Panchenko, and A. Zaslavsky (2012), Goniopolarimetric inversion using SVD: An application to type III radio bursts observed by STEREO, J. Geophys. Res., 117, A06101.

AccessURL.Name: FTPS from SPDF (not with most browsers)
AccessURL.Description: Access to Data in CDF Format via ftps from SPDF

AccessURL.Name: HTTPS from SPDF
AccessURL.Description: Access to Data in CDF Format via https from SPDF

AccessURL.Name: CDAWeb
AccessURL.Description: Access to ASCII, CDF, and Plots via NASA/GSFC CDAWeb

AccessInformation.Acknowledgement: Please acknowledge the Principal Investigator Milan Maksimovic (milan.maksimovic@obspm.fr) and Stuart D. Bale (bale@berkeley.edu). Please acknowledge the Data Providers and CDAWeb when using these Data.

Parameter.Name: Epoch (Time)
Parameter.Description: Epoch encoded as Terrestrial Time on rotating Earth geoid, ns since J2000
Parameter.Caveats: This Parameter exhibits an increasing Monotonic Progression

Parameter.Name: Frequency
Parameter.Description: Frequency channel

Parameter.Name: Receiver Background
Parameter.Description: 1% receiver background of each antenna channel configuration

Parameter.Name: Antenna Configuration
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: Epoch
Parameter.Description: Dual channel receiver antenna configuration
Parameter.Caveats: 00 (Off/Off) 10 (+Ex/Off) 20 (-Ey/Off) 30 (Ex-Ey/Off) 01 (Off/+Ez) 02 (Off/+Ey) 03 (Off/Ez-Ey) 11 (+Ex/+Ez) 12 (+Ex/-Ey) 13 (+Ex/Ez-Ey) 21 (-Ey/+Ez) 31 (Ex-Ey/+Ez) -22 (-Ey/-Ey) -32 (Ex-Ey/-Ey) -23 (-Ey/Ez-Ey) -33 (Ex-Ey/Ez-Ey)

Parameter.Name: Time Offset
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: Epoch
Parameter.Description: Temporal offset of each antenna channel configuration

Parameter.Name: Power Spectral Density
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: Epoch
Parameter.Description: Power spectral density before 1% background subtraction and antenna calibration
Parameter.Caveats: Suitable for analysis of weak signals

Parameter.Name: Power Spectral Density
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: Epoch
Parameter.Description: Power spectral density after 1% background subtraction and antenna calibration
Parameter.Caveats: Suitable for general investigation

Parameter.Name: Power Spectral Density
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: Epoch
Parameter.Description: Power spectral density after 1% background subtraction and antenna calibration in solar radio flux unit normalized to 1 au
Parameter.Caveats: Suitable for multi-spacecraft investigation

Parameter.Name: Stokes I
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: Epoch
Parameter.Description: Radio flux density [Data available after 04-May-2007]
Parameter.Caveats: Details on polarization parameters can be found here: https://doi.org/10.1007/s11214-007-9255-6

Parameter.Name: Stokes Q
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: Epoch
Parameter.Description: Normalized linear polarization [Data available after 04-May-2007]
Parameter.Caveats: Details on polarization parameters can be found here: https://doi.org/10.1007/s11214-007-9255-6

Parameter.Name: Stokes U
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: Epoch
Parameter.Description: Normalized linear polarization [Data available after 04-May-2007]
Parameter.Caveats: Details on polarization parameters can be found here: https://doi.org/10.1007/s11214-007-9255-6

Parameter.Name: Stokes V
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: Epoch
Parameter.Description: Normalized circular polarization [Data available after 04-May-2007]
Parameter.Caveats: Details on polarization parameters can be found here: https://doi.org/10.1007/s11214-007-9255-6

Parameter.Name: Source Size
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: Epoch
Parameter.Description: The angular half aperture of the source as seen by a spacecraft (uniform profile) [Data available after 04-May-2007]
Parameter.Caveats: Based on https://doi.org/10.1029/2011JA017333

Parameter.Name: Colatitude
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: Epoch
Parameter.Description: Wave vector colatitude in the Radial-Tangential-Normal (RTN) system [Data available after 04-May-2007]
Parameter.Caveats: X axis points from the spacecraft center to Sun, and the Y axis is the cross product of the solar rotational axis and X, and lies in the solar equatorial plane (towards the West limb).

Parameter.Name: Azimuth
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: Epoch
Parameter.Description: Wave vector azimuth in the Radial-Tangential-Normal (RTN) system [Data available after 04-May-2007]
Parameter.Caveats: X axis points from the spacecraft center to Sun, and the Y axis is the cross product of the solar rotational axis and X, and lies in the solar equatorial plane (towards the West limb).

Parameter.Name: Colatitude
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: Epoch
Parameter.Description: Wave vector colatitude in the Heliocentric Inertial (HCI) system [Data available after 04-May-2007]
Parameter.Caveats: Z is the solar north rotational axis, and X is the solar ascending node on the J2000 ecliptic.

Parameter.Name: Azimuth
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: Epoch
Parameter.Description: Wave vector azimuth in the Heliocentric Inertial (HCI) system [Data available after 04-May-2007]
Parameter.Caveats: Z is the solar north rotational axis, and X is the solar ascending node on the J2000 ecliptic.

Parameter.Name: Colatitude
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: Epoch
Parameter.Description: Wave vector colatitude in the Heliocentric Earth Ecliptic (HEE) system [Data available after 04-May-2007]
Parameter.Caveats: X is the Sun-Earth line, and Z is the north pole for the ecliptic of date.

Parameter.Name: Azimuth
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: Epoch
Parameter.Description: Wave vector azimuth in the Heliocentric Earth Ecliptic (HEE) system [Data available after 04-May-2007]
Parameter.Caveats: X is the Sun-Earth line, and Z is the north pole for the ecliptic of date.

Parameter.Name: Colatitude
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: Epoch
Parameter.Description: Wave vector colatitude in the Heliocentric Earth Equatorial (HEEQ) system [Data available after 04-May-2007]
Parameter.Caveats: Z is the solar rotation axis, and X is in the plane containing the Z axis and Earth, at the intersection of the solar central meridian, and the heliographic equator. When converted to longitude and latitude, this is known as Stonyhurst heliographic coordinates.

Parameter.Name: Azimuth
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: Epoch
Parameter.Description: Wave vector azimuth in the Heliocentric Earth Equatorial (HEEQ) system [Data available after 04-May-2007]
Parameter.Caveats: Z is the solar rotation axis, and X is in the plane containing the Z axis and Earth, at the intersection of the solar central meridian, and the heliographic equator. When converted to longitude and latitude, this is known as Stonyhurst heliographic coordinates.

Parameter.Name: Spacecraft Position in HCI
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: Epoch
Parameter.Description: STEREO spacecraft position in the Heliocentric Inertial (HCI) system in km
Parameter.Caveats: Also called Ecliptic J2000. Z is the solar north rotational axis, and X is the solar ascending node on the J2000 ecliptic.

Parameter.Name: Spacecraft Position in HEE
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: Epoch
Parameter.Description: STEREO spacecraft position in the Heliocentric Earth Ecliptic (HEE) system in km
Parameter.Caveats: X is the Sun-Earth line, and Z is the north pole for the ecliptic of date.

Parameter.Name: Spacecraft Position in HEEQ
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: Epoch
Parameter.Description: STEREO spacecraft position in the Heliocentric Earth Equatorial (HEEQ) system in km
Parameter.Caveats: Z is the solar rotation axis, and X is in the plane containing the Z axis and Earth, at the intersection of the solar central meridian, and the heliographic equator. When converted to longitude and latitude, this is known as Stonyhurst heliographic coordinates.
